content: Sure, According to the US Census Bureau, Saginaw is a racially and ethnically diverse city, with a population of approximately 48,000 residents. The largest racial group is white, comprising 34.3% of the population, followed by African American or Black residents making up 57.4% of the population, and Hispanic or Latino residents making up 4.4% of the population. The American Indian and Alaska Native population constitutes 0.4%, while Asian residents comprise 0.8% of Saginaw's population, and Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander residents add up to 0.1%. Additionally, 2.6% of the population identifies as two or more races or ethnicities.
